summary: The Interstate Obscenity Definition Act aims to define obscenity within the context of the Communications Act of 1934. It amends the Act to provide a specific definition of "obscene" or "obscenity" pertaining to visual depictions, including those that appeal to prurient interests, depict sexual acts with the intent to arouse, and lack serious value. The bill also makes a technical amendment to align related sections of the Communications Act.
